item.title: Dubai’s 4 Elegant Polo and Equestrian Club Communities
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
Polo and equestrian club communities in Dubai represent the pinnacle of luxurious, nature-inspired living, offering an exclusive lifestyle for those who appreciate both elegance and sport. Nestled within vast green landscapes, these residential havens provide a serene escape from the city’s hustle, while also delivering world-class amenities and direct access to equestrian facilities. With luxury residences, a strong sense of community, and a passion for equestrian sports at their heart, these developments have become a sought-after choice for high-net-worth individuals and families seeking a blend of luxury and leisure in one of Dubai’s most prestigious settings. 1. Al Habtoor Polo & Equestrian Club – The Residences The Residences at Al Habtoor Polo Club is an exclusive community of 122 luxury villas located in the heart of Dubailand, along E611 Emirates Road. This prestigious development is a haven for polo enthusiasts and those who appreciate refined living surrounded by lush greenery. The villas are designed with a focus on elegance, offering a perfect balance of aesthetics and comfort. Previous slide Next slide Habtoor Polo & Equestiran Club and residences (photo credits to Metropolitan Premium Properties) Spanning an impressive 6 million square feet, Al Habtoor Polo & Equestrian Club is the centerpiece of this community, featuring a luxurious Andalusian-style hotel, upscale bars, and diverse dining options. As the Middle East’s premier destination for polo, the club fosters a unique lifestyle centered around equestrian sports, offering residents direct access to world-class facilities. The seamless blend of nature, luxury, and sports creates an unparalleled living experience where tranquility and activity coexist harmoniously. 2. Verdes by Haven Verdes by Haven is an upcoming residential community strategically located opposite the Al Habtoor Polo Resort, promising a tranquil and upscale lifestyle for its residents. This prime location allows residents to immerse themselves in the vibrant atmosphere of world-class polo matches while enjoying breathtaking views of the lush green fields that characterize this elite sporting venue. Previous slide Next slide Beyond the stunning vistas, Verdes by Haven is designed to offer a holistic living experience, with a variety of exceptional amenities that enhance daily life. Residents will have access to luxurious swimming pools, perfect for relaxation and leisure. State-of-the-art fitness centers will cater to health enthusiasts, providing a space for residents to maintain their wellness routines. 3. Polo Homes at Arabian Ranches Polo Homes in Arabian Ranches presents a unique blend of distinctive style and exceptional luxury that is hard to find elsewhere. This exclusive community features the privacy of a gated neighborhood while fostering a warm, family-friendly atmosphere. The residents of Polo Homes are primarily esteemed business professionals, contributing to a sophisticated and vibrant community. Previous slide Next slide Polo Homes at the Arabian Ranches (photo credits to: LuxuryProperty & Metropolitan Premium Properties) The design of Polo Homes reflects an elegant architectural aesthetic, characterized by spacious layouts and high-quality finishes that cater to modern living. Each residence offers a harmonious blend of comfort and opulence, creating an inviting space for families to thrive. The community is particularly appealing to those with a passion for polo and equestrian sports, as it is conveniently located near the prestigious Dubai Polo and Equestrian Club.  4. Villanova Villanova is a beautifully designed Mediterranean-inspired community that offers a diverse selection of townhouses and villas. Nestled near the Al Habtoor Polo Resort and Club, it provides a harmonious blend of luxury living and a close-knit community atmosphere, making it an attractive option for families seeking both elegance and a sense of belonging. Previous slide Next slide The design of Villanova is intended to foster a strong community spirit, with vibrant amenities that encourage social interaction and active lifestyles. Community centers serve as gathering spaces for residents, while recreational areas are thoughtfully integrated throughout the neighborhood, offering a variety of activities for all ages. The pedestrian-friendly walkways promote a healthy lifestyle, making it easy for families to enjoy leisurely strolls or bike rides while connecting with neighbors.

The post Dubai’s 4 Elegant Polo and Equestrian Club Communities appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
Polo and equestrian club communities in Dubai represent the pinnacle of luxurious, nature-inspired living, offering an exclusive lifestyle for those who appreciate both elegance and sport. Nestled within vast green landscapes, these residential havens provide a serene escape from the city’s hustle, while also delivering world-class amenities and direct access to equestrian facilities. With luxury residences, a strong sense of community, and a passion for equestrian sports at their heart, these developments have become a sought-after choice for high-net-worth individuals and families seeking a blend of luxury and leisure in one of Dubai’s most prestigious settings.

1. Al Habtoor Polo & Equestrian Club - The Residences

The Residences at Al Habtoor Polo Club is an exclusive community of 122 luxury villas located in the heart of Dubailand, along E611 Emirates Road. This prestigious development is a haven for polo enthusiasts and those who appreciate refined living surrounded by lush greenery. The villas are designed with a focus on elegance, offering a perfect balance of aesthetics and comfort.

Habtoor Polo & Equestiran Club and residences (photo credits to Metropolitan Premium Properties)

Spanning an impressive 6 million square feet, Al Habtoor Polo & Equestrian Club is the centerpiece of this community, featuring a luxurious Andalusian-style hotel, upscale bars, and diverse dining options. As the Middle East’s premier destination for polo, the club fosters a unique lifestyle centered around equestrian sports, offering residents direct access to world-class facilities. The seamless blend of nature, luxury, and sports creates an unparalleled living experience where tranquility and activity coexist harmoniously.

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

2. Verdes by Haven

Verdes by Haven is an upcoming residential community strategically located opposite the Al Habtoor Polo Resort, promising a tranquil and upscale lifestyle for its residents. This prime location allows residents to immerse themselves in the vibrant atmosphere of world-class polo matches while enjoying breathtaking views of the lush green fields that characterize this elite sporting venue.
Beyond the stunning vistas, Verdes by Haven is designed to offer a holistic living experience, with a variety of exceptional amenities that enhance daily life. Residents will have access to luxurious swimming pools, perfect for relaxation and leisure. State-of-the-art fitness centers will cater to health enthusiasts, providing a space for residents to maintain their wellness routines.

3. Polo Homes at Arabian Ranches

Polo Homes in Arabian Ranches presents a unique blend of distinctive style and exceptional luxury that is hard to find elsewhere. This exclusive community features the privacy of a gated neighborhood while fostering a warm, family-friendly atmosphere. The residents of Polo Homes are primarily esteemed business professionals, contributing to a sophisticated and vibrant community.

Polo Homes at the Arabian Ranches (photo credits to: LuxuryProperty & Metropolitan Premium Properties)

The design of Polo Homes reflects an elegant architectural aesthetic, characterized by spacious layouts and high-quality finishes that cater to modern living. Each residence offers a harmonious blend of comfort and opulence, creating an inviting space for families to thrive. The community is particularly appealing to those with a passion for polo and equestrian sports, as it is conveniently located near the prestigious Dubai Polo and Equestrian Club. 

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

4. Villanova

Villanova is a beautifully designed Mediterranean-inspired community that offers a diverse selection of townhouses and villas. Nestled near the Al Habtoor Polo Resort and Club, it provides a harmonious blend of luxury living and a close-knit community atmosphere, making it an attractive option for families seeking both elegance and a sense of belonging.

The design of Villanova is intended to foster a strong community spirit, with vibrant amenities that encourage social interaction and active lifestyles. Community centers serve as gathering spaces for residents, while recreational areas are thoughtfully integrated throughout the neighborhood, offering a variety of activities for all ages. The pedestrian-friendly walkways promote a healthy lifestyle, making it easy for families to enjoy leisurely strolls or bike rides while connecting with neighbors.

item.title: Dubai’s 5 Stunning Golf Course Communities
item.dc:creator: Post
item.description:
Golf course communities in Dubai are synonymous with luxury living, offering a unique blend of breathtaking landscapes and opulent amenities. Renowned for its stunning architecture and vibrant lifestyle, Dubai stands as a premier destination for those seeking an upscale living experience. Nestled amid lush fairways and pristine greens, these exclusive neighborhoods provide not only spectacular views but also an enriching lifestyle centered around the game of golf. In this article, we explore five of the most enchanting golf course communities in Dubai, each showcasing its own distinct charm and upscale offerings. 1. Emaar South Emaar South Community in Dubai South is a vibrant and inviting neighborhood that perfectly embodies modern luxury. Boasting an impressive 18-hole championship golf course, the community features stunning views from its apartments, villas, and townhouses. Surrounded by lush green landscapes and exceptional amenities, Emaar South offers an exquisite blend of comfort and elegance. This community seamlessly integrates upscale living with serene relaxation, all set against the backdrop of Dubai’s dynamic landscape.  2. Jumeirah Golf Estates Previous slide Next slide Jumeirah Golf Estates is a luxurious community featuring upscale residences and home to 2 renowned golf courses: Earth and Fire. It has also been nominated for the World Golf Awards 2024 in various categories including “Middle East’s Best Golf Course 2024”, “World’s Best Golf Clubhouse 2024” and “United Arab Emirates’ Best Golf Course 2024” to name a few. Earth Course: Designed by Greg Norman, this course boasts beautifully manicured fairways, challenging water hazards, and striking white bunkers set against lush landscapes. Its layout, inspired by European and North American parkland courses, offers a mix of scenic views and strategic holes for golfers of all skill levels. Fire Course: Also designed by Greg Norman, Fire integrates with the natural desert landscape, presenting a challenging experience that matches its name. Its refined color palette enhances the course’s unique character. 3. Emirates Hills Emirates Hills offers some of the most luxurious villas. The prestigious gated community of Emirates Hills is conveniently located near the Address Montgomerie Club and Golf Course. Residents have the option to become members of this world-renowned golf course, which features lush fairways and an 18-hole championship layout. Covering 265 acres, it is considered one of the most challenging courses globally, boasting 14 picturesque lakes and a five-star award-winning hotel. 4. Arabian Ranches The upscale villa and townhouse community of Arabian Ranches is conveniently located near the Arabian Ranches Golf Club, featuring an 18-hole signature course designed by Ian Baker-Finch. The design concept for this golf course was inspired by the authentic desert-style courses of Scottsdale, Arizona. Measuring an impressive 7,658 yards, it presents a genuine challenge for golfers. The elegant Spanish Colonial Clubhouse houses the Ranches Restaurant, which offers breathtaking views of the 9th and 18th greens.  5. Dubai Hills The 2,700-acre Dubai Hills development is part of Mohammed bin Rashid (MBR) City. This community features mansions with views of the Dubai Hills Golf Club. Located in the heart of Dubai Hills Estate, the golf club covers an impressive 1.2 million square meters. The course itself spans 119 hectares—approximately the size of 63 football fields—and includes a series of valleys, wadis, and a network of lakes, providing a remarkable golfing experience.

The post Dubai’s 5 Stunning Golf Course Communities appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
Golf course communities in Dubai are synonymous with luxury living, offering a unique blend of breathtaking landscapes and opulent amenities. Renowned for its stunning architecture and vibrant lifestyle, Dubai stands as a premier destination for those seeking an upscale living experience. Nestled amid lush fairways and pristine greens, these exclusive neighborhoods provide not only spectacular views but also an enriching lifestyle centered around the game of golf. In this article, we explore five of the most enchanting golf course communities in Dubai, each showcasing its own distinct charm and upscale offerings.

1. Emaar South

Emaar South Community in Dubai South is a vibrant and inviting neighborhood that perfectly embodies modern luxury. Boasting an impressive 18-hole championship golf course, the community features stunning views from its apartments, villas, and townhouses. Surrounded by lush green landscapes and exceptional amenities, Emaar South offers an exquisite blend of comfort and elegance. This community seamlessly integrates upscale living with serene relaxation, all set against the backdrop of Dubai’s dynamic landscape.

2. Jumeirah Golf Estates

Jumeirah Golf Estates is a luxurious community featuring upscale residences and home to 2 renowned golf courses: Earth and Fire. It has also been nominated for the World Golf Awards 2024 in various categories including “Middle East’s Best Golf Course 2024”, “World’s Best Golf Clubhouse 2024” and “United Arab Emirates’ Best Golf Course 2024” to name a few.

Earth Course: Designed by Greg Norman, this course boasts beautifully manicured fairways, challenging water hazards, and striking white bunkers set against lush landscapes. Its layout, inspired by European and North American parkland courses, offers a mix of scenic views and strategic holes for golfers of all skill levels.

Emirates Hills offers some of the most luxurious villas. The prestigious gated community of Emirates Hills is conveniently located near the Address Montgomerie Club and Golf Course. Residents have the option to become members of this world-renowned golf course, which features lush fairways and an 18-hole championship layout. The course itself spans 119 hectares—approximately the size of 63 football fields—and includes a series of valleys, wadis, and a network of lakes, providing a remarkable golfing experience.

item.title: Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
European millionaires are choosing the United Arab Emirates as a top destination for living. According to a report from Henley Private Wealth Management on millionaire migration trends. The current number of millionaires in Dubai alone witnessed a growth of 78% the past decade. Therefore, declaring Dubai as the city with the highest number of millionaires in the Middle East. As of September 2024, there are over 72,500 millionaires living in Dubai. The UAE is set to welcome around 6700 more by the end of 2024. Tax & Economic Concerns A recent survey demonstrates that 44% of 518 European millionaires consider relocating to Dubai. They are looking to relocate for the better economic opportunities and living standards that Dubai offers. Although the influx of Russian residents to the UAE has decreased, it has been somewhat balanced by a growing number of European and British immigrants. In the UK, the rising interest to relocate stems from the current left-wing government. They are expressing concern over the potential tax spikes as well as the overall economic situation in the future. In France, the prospect of a hard-right government and its potential punitive measures against the wealthy has sparked concern among the country’s millionaire class. Italy is also in a similar position. Due to the existing right-wing government, the country is experiencing an outflow of wealthy individuals, seeking location with stable environments for their assets. Germany is gradually witnessing a potential outflow of millionaires. There is a rise in hard-right advocates, spiking concerns among the country’s wealthy. This will potentially lead to an increase in millionaire influx to Dubai from Germany. Spanish and Portuguese investors are diverting towards Dubai. As per our observations, many of them are investing to diversify their investment portfolio within the UAE. Best Places to Retire in Dubai Read More Investment Appeal The appeal of Dubai also stems from the growing popularity of the Golden Visa by Investment. The UAE offers different investment visa options, and 34% of the European millionaires surveyed expressed interest in utilizing those programs. Not only that, but as of Q1 2024, French and Italian buyers have been dominating the Dubai’s property market. This surge in property investments from Europeans displays the seriousness of the situation in Europe. Similarly, Portuguese investors are on the rise. Our latest data shows that around 350 Portuguese citizens own over 800 properties in Dubai, worth over 222 million euros. Why analyze European millionaire influx? The influx of European millionaires can significantly affect Dubai’s economy and society. Their high-end property purchases are already boosting the local real estate market. These wealthy individuals may also start new businesses, invest more, and share their expertise. However, this influx could increase prices for high-end goods and services.

The post Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
European millionaires are choosing the United Arab Emirates as a top destination for living. According to a report from Henley Private Wealth Management on millionaire migration trends. The current number of millionaires in Dubai alone witnessed a growth of 78% the past decade. Therefore, declaring Dubai as the city with the highest number of millionaires in the Middle East. As of September 2024, there are over 72,500 millionaires living in Dubai. The UAE is set to welcome around 6700 more by the end of 2024.

Tax & Economic Concerns

A recent survey demonstrates that 44% of 518 European millionaires consider relocating to Dubai. They are looking to relocate for the better economic opportunities and living standards that Dubai offers.

Although the influx of Russian residents to the UAE has decreased, it has been somewhat balanced by a growing number of European and British immigrants. In the UK, the rising interest to relocate stems from the current left-wing government. They are expressing concern over the potential tax spikes as well as the overall economic situation in the future.

In France, the prospect of a hard-right government and its potential punitive measures against the wealthy has sparked concern among the country’s millionaire class. Italy is also in a similar position. Due to the existing right-wing government, the country is experiencing an outflow of wealthy individuals, seeking location with stable environments for their assets.

Germany is gradually witnessing a potential outflow of millionaires. There is a rise in hard-right advocates, spiking concerns among the country’s wealthy. This will potentially lead to an increase in millionaire influx to Dubai from Germany.

Spanish and Portuguese investors are diverting towards Dubai. As per our observations, many of them are investing to diversify their investment portfolio within the UAE.

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

Investment Appeal

The appeal of Dubai also stems from the growing popularity of the Golden Visa by Investment. The UAE offers different investment visa options, and 34% of the European millionaires surveyed expressed interest in utilizing those programs.

Not only that, but as of Q1 2024, French and Italian buyers have been dominating the Dubai’s property market. This surge in property investments from Europeans displays the seriousness of the situation in Europe.

Similarly, Portuguese investors are on the rise. Our latest data shows that around 350 Portuguese citizens own over 800 properties in Dubai, worth over 222 million euros.

Why analyze European millionaire influx?

The influx of European millionaires can significantly affect Dubai’s economy and society. Their high-end property purchases are already boosting the local real estate market. These wealthy individuals may also start new businesses, invest more, and share their expertise. However, this influx could increase prices for high-end goods and services.

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Best Places to retire in Dubai

item.title: Malaysians & Indonesians in Dubai: Business, Tourism & Restaurants
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
The South Asian community is a rising ethnic group within the UAE, consisting of over 59% of the total population of the country. Malaysian and Indonesian communities within the UAE are prominent. The number of Indonesians in the UAE was estimated to be around 77,000 in 2020, with the majority living in Dubai. Latest records gathered estimates that around 7000 Malaysians live in the UAE, with at least half residing in Dubai. At least 20% of both communities are professional, working individuals, notably as engineers in the oil and gas fields as well as health and hospitality sectors. Business: Malaysian foodstuff companies are on the rise, with many companies eyeing to expand globally. Gulfood, the largest F&B show held in February of this year in Dubai, has welcomed 82 Malaysian Companies that are under the National Trade Promotion Agency (MATRADE). These companies have displayed frozen foods, including ready-to-eat meals, spiced meats, various foods, beverages and sauces. Malaysian companies have experienced increased acceptance towards diverse, Malaysian Cuisine. Food exports to the UAE from Malaysia have since been increasing, reaching over AED 460.4 million as of 2023, mainly contributed by products including cocoa, processed seafood and dairy products. Indonesian companies have been steadily increasing, marking their presence in the Emirate. As of Q1 2024, the number of active Indonesian companies in Dubai reached 114, marking a 293% increase since 2014. As of 2023, total Indonesian investments in Dubai reached AED 188 million, accounting for at least 87% of total Indonesian investments over the past 5 years. The Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) between the two countries has been in effect since September 2023, which is expected to increase the annual bilateral trade to up to $10 billion within five years by removing trade barriers on various goods and services. Tourism: As of the first half of 2024, visitors from South Asia and Southeast Asia constituted around 27% from the total number of visitors, which was over 9.3 million. As per the latest data we have gathered, Dubai has recorded over 75,000 arrivals from Indonesia as of 2023, highlighting a 36% increase from the previous year. Dubai Tourism has recently conducted its Dubai Tourism Roadshow in Jakarta to further boost its inbound arrivals from Indonesia with the aim to meet its target of 100,000 travelers by the end of the year. Weekly flights between Dubai and Kuala Lampur exceed 48 flights weekly, with Emirates Airlines operating 21 flights between Dubai and Kuala Lumpur weekly alone. Restaurants: Dubai offers a rich tapestry of culinary experiences, and among them, Southeast Asian cuisine stands out with its vibrant flavors and diverse offerings. Below are some of the popular Southeast Asian restaurants in Dubai that cater to various tastes and preferences. 1. Andaliman: located at Za’abeel 1, Andaliman is a culinary voyage that balances both tradition and innovation. This restaurant offers authentic Indonesian food with a contemporary touch to enhance the dining experience.   2. Rasa Sayang: Located near the Malaysia Trade Center in Bur Dubai, this restaurant offers a variety of traditional Asian and Malaysian cuisines to suit all tastes. 3. Asian Wok: Asian Wok is UAE-born restaurant located in Business Bay, with various other branches across Dubai. This restaurant takes pride in its fresh ingredients and in-house made Wok sauces.

The post Malaysians & Indonesians in Dubai: Business, Tourism & Restaurants appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
The South Asian community is a rising ethnic group within the UAE, consisting of over 59% of the total population of the country. Malaysian and Indonesian communities within the UAE are prominent. The number of Indonesians in the UAE was estimated to be around 77,000 in 2020, with the majority living in Dubai. Latest records gathered estimates that around 7000 Malaysians live in the UAE, with at least half residing in Dubai. At least 20% of both communities are professional, working individuals, notably as engineers in the oil and gas fields as well as health and hospitality sectors.

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

Business:

Malaysian foodstuff companies are on the rise, with many companies eyeing to expand globally. Gulfood, the largest F&B show held in February of this year in Dubai, has welcomed 82 Malaysian Companies that are under the National Trade Promotion Agency (MATRADE). These companies have displayed frozen foods, including ready-to-eat meals, spiced meats, various foods, beverages and sauces.

Malaysian companies have experienced increased acceptance towards diverse, Malaysian Cuisine. Food exports to the UAE from Malaysia have since been increasing, reaching over AED 460.4 million as of 2023, mainly contributed by products including cocoa, processed seafood and dairy products.

Indonesian companies have been steadily increasing, marking their presence in the Emirate. As of Q1 2024, the number of active Indonesian companies in Dubai reached 114, marking a 293% increase since 2014. As of 2023, total Indonesian investments in Dubai reached AED 188 million, accounting for at least 87% of total Indonesian investments over the past 5 years. The Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA) between the two countries has been in effect since September 2023, which is expected to increase the annual bilateral trade to up to $10 billion within five years by removing trade barriers on various goods and services.

Tourism:

As of the first half of 2024, visitors from South Asia and Southeast Asia constituted around 27% from the total number of visitors, which was over 9.3 million. As per the latest data we have gathered, Dubai has recorded over 75,000 arrivals from Indonesia as of 2023, highlighting a 36% increase from the previous year.

Dubai Tourism has recently conducted its Dubai Tourism Roadshow in Jakarta to further boost its inbound arrivals from Indonesia with the aim to meet its target of 100,000 travelers by the end of the year.

Weekly flights between Dubai and Kuala Lampur exceed 48 flights weekly, with Emirates Airlines operating 21 flights between Dubai and Kuala Lumpur weekly alone.

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

Restaurants:

Dubai offers a rich tapestry of culinary experiences, and among them, Southeast Asian cuisine stands out with its vibrant flavors and diverse offerings. Below are some of the popular Southeast Asian restaurants in Dubai that cater to various tastes and preferences.

1. Andaliman: located at Za’abeel 1, Andaliman is a culinary voyage that balances both tradition and innovation. This restaurant offers authentic Indonesian food with a contemporary touch to enhance the dining experience.  

2. Rasa Sayang: Located near the Malaysia Trade Center in Bur Dubai, this restaurant offers a variety of traditional Asian and Malaysian cuisines to suit all tastes.

3. Asian Wok: Asian Wok is UAE-born restaurant located in Business Bay, with various other branches across Dubai. This restaurant takes pride in its fresh ingredients and in-house made Wok sauces.

item.title: Portuguese in Dubai: Business, Tourism & Restaurants
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
Dubai’s cosmopolitan environment makes it a welcoming home for diverse communities, including a rising Portuguese community. With around 3,000 Portuguese expats, Dubai hosts the largest Portuguese community in the region. These individuals are primarily professionals working in sectors such as technology, trade, health, and manufacturing. Their presence highlights the city’s appeal as a hub for skilled talent. The Portuguese in Dubai contribute to the city’s multicultural fabric, blending their cultural influences into the local scene. “Portuguese in Dubai: Business, Tourism, and Restaurants” showcases the community’s impact on the city’s economy, tourism appeal and diverse culinary experience.  Tourism: As of the first half of 2024, visitors from Western Europe constituted around 20% from the total number of visitors, which was over 9.3 million. As per the latest data we have gathered, Portuguese visitors to Dubai during pre-pandemic times exceeded 130,000 annually. This growing tendency is expected to have grown further due to Dubai’s position as a touristic hub worldwide. Various road shows have continued to take place to attract Portuguese visitors. For instance, the Dubai Tourism Roadshow, that took place on March 12th and 13th of this year in Lisbon has been a great success, where the Portuguese public were introduced to Dubai as a worldwide leading touristic destination, Restaurants: Cuisine options in Dubai are diverse, and within this diversity rises prominent Portuguese and Portuguese-style restaurants to accommodate all needs. Below are some of the popular Portuguese restaurants in Dubai. 1. Tasca by Jose Avillez Located at the Jumeirah Beach Road, Tasca is a Mediterranean-Portuguese style restaurant by the culinary genius Jose Avillez. Tasca in Dubai is the Chef’s first international opening, which quickly earned this restaurant a Michelin-star. Average Cost for two: 147 euros. 2. Lana Lusa This restaurant/bar concept is located in Jumeirah 2 and offers dishes and flavors inspired by Portuguese roots. Visitors can enjoy a nice drink at the bar, grab a table to enjoy a delicious meal or have a casual meal at the open terrace. Average Cost for two: 100 euros. 3. Oanjo Located at the Sheraton, Mall of the Emirates, Oanjo offers a fusion of Southern European flair mixed with delicate, oriental flavors from Portugal and Japan. Visitors can enjoy dishes of sensational flavors amidst the 360-degree panoramic views of Dubai. Average Cost for two: 90 euros.

The post Portuguese in Dubai: Business, Tourism & Restaurants appeared first on Only Luxury.

item.title: Popular Japanese Cafes in the UAE
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
Coffee shops are one of the most sought after places by residents in the UAE. Coffee is an important aspect of the Arabian and Gulf culture. Therefore, trying new types of coffee will always be on demand. Another factor to consider is that the majority of residents do not drink alcohol, so visiting a coffee shop would be far more enjoyable to socialize than going to a bar. Since the demand for coffee shops is increasing, a growing trend has been the establishment of different Japanese coffee shops. Notable Japanese cafes have recently opened across the UAE to bring authentic Japanese taste into the country. 1. % Arabica Arabica is a new, specialty coffee concept that originated in Japan and roasts some of the best coffee beans from all around the world, including coffee roasts from their own coffee farm. It incorporates simple, minimalistic Japanese design throughout their cafes and serves high quality coffee beans, allowing coffee enthusiasts to “see the world through coffee”. This coffee concept currently has over 14 branches across the UAE, mainly in Abu Dhabi, Dubai and Sharjah. 2. Yamanote Atelier Yamanote Atelier is a UAE-born bakery and café concept that first opened its doors back in 2013. Their story started with their deep admiration and appreciation towards Japanese flavors and baking. Since their opening, Yamanote’s reputation grew further and they currently have 7 branches across Abu Dhabi and Dubai. The atmosphere at Yamanote incorporates Japanese minimalism and pastel colors, with a touch of bright colors inspired by Parisian cafes to add an edgy touch. The Atelier serves a variety of Japanese pastries, breakfast dishes, desserts and authentic coffee. 3. Yakitate Boutique Since their first opening in Dubai, Yakitate has gained growing popularity for their contemporary appeal, adding a quirky touch into traditional Japanese dishes. Yakitate takes pride in baking a variety of cakes, pastries and bread on the premises and with no use of any preservatives. Yakitate offers a variety of choices to choose from, all served with a twist. For instance, a traditional vegetarian sushi that looks like a pizza or a burger meal served with rice buns. Multitude of drinks are also offered to suit all needs, including matcha drinks, different soda combinations, milk tea and a variety of coffee twists. 4. Otaku Restaurant & Café The story began in 2019. The founder, who is a frequent traveler, wanted to combine a modern approach with Japanese aesthetics. With 3 operating branches across Abu Dhabi and Dubai, Otaku is described as a place with the philosophy of a home. People come together to enjoy a cup of coffee amidst the earthy tones and minimalism integrated within the café. Otaku offers a variety of authentic Japanese coffee, pastries and dishes to choose from. Ranging from fluffy Japanese pancakes and main dishes all the way to different matcha flavored drinks.  5. Notable Mention: Papa Fluffy Papa Fluffy is a dessert shop and the first in the UAE to launch different flavored Japanese birthday cheesecakes. With several branches operating across the UAE and abroad, this gourmet bakery has soon gained a lot of popularity for their “fluffy” cakes.  Papa Fluffy offers fluffy, Japanese cheesecakes in various flavors, including vanilla, chocolate and pistachio flavors. In addition, there are tarts and special cakes to celebrate special occasions.

The post Popular Japanese Cafes in the UAE appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
Coffee shops are one of the most sought after places by residents in the UAE. Coffee is an important aspect of the Arabian and Gulf culture. Therefore, trying new types of coffee will always be on demand. Another factor to consider is that the majority of residents do not drink alcohol, so visiting a coffee shop would be far more enjoyable to socialize than going to a bar.

Since the demand for coffee shops is increasing, a growing trend has been the establishment of different Japanese coffee shops. Notable Japanese cafes have recently opened across the UAE to bring authentic Japanese taste into the country.

1. % Arabica

Arabica is a new, specialty coffee concept that originated in Japan and roasts some of the best coffee beans from all around the world, including coffee roasts from their own coffee farm.

It incorporates simple, minimalistic Japanese design throughout their cafes and serves high quality coffee beans, allowing coffee enthusiasts to “see the world through coffee”. This coffee concept currently has over 14 branches across the UAE, mainly in Abu Dhabi, Dubai and Sharjah.

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

2. Yamanote Atelier

Yamanote Atelier is a UAE-born bakery and café concept that first opened its doors back in 2013. Their story started with their deep admiration and appreciation towards Japanese flavors and baking. Since their opening, Yamanote’s reputation grew further and they currently have 7 branches across Abu Dhabi and Dubai.

The atmosphere at Yamanote incorporates Japanese minimalism and pastel colors, with a touch of bright colors inspired by Parisian cafes to add an edgy touch. The Atelier serves a variety of Japanese pastries, breakfast dishes, desserts and authentic coffee.

3. Yakitate Boutique

Since their first opening in Dubai, Yakitate has gained growing popularity for their contemporary appeal, adding a quirky touch into traditional Japanese dishes. Yakitate takes pride in baking a variety of cakes, pastries and bread on the premises and with no use of any preservatives.

Yakitate offers a variety of choices to choose from, all served with a twist. For instance, a traditional vegetarian sushi that looks like a pizza or a burger meal served with rice buns. Multitude of drinks are also offered to suit all needs, including matcha drinks, different soda combinations, milk tea and a variety of coffee twists.

4. Otaku Restaurant & Café

The story began in 2019. The founder, who is a frequent traveler, wanted to combine a modern approach with Japanese aesthetics. With 3 operating branches across Abu Dhabi and Dubai, Otaku is described as a place with the philosophy of a home. People come together to enjoy a cup of coffee amidst the earthy tones and minimalism integrated within the café.

Otaku offers a variety of authentic Japanese coffee, pastries and dishes to choose from. Ranging from fluffy Japanese pancakes and main dishes all the way to different matcha flavored drinks. 

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

5. Notable Mention: Papa Fluffy

Papa Fluffy is a dessert shop and the first in the UAE to launch different flavored Japanese birthday cheesecakes. With several branches operating across the UAE and abroad, this gourmet bakery has soon gained a lot of popularity for their “fluffy” cakes. 

Papa Fluffy offers fluffy, Japanese cheesecakes in various flavors, including vanilla, chocolate and pistachio flavors. In addition, there are tarts and special cakes to celebrate special occasions.

item.title: Growth of European Visitors to Dubai
item.dc:creator: admin
item.description:
Dubai’s tourism sector has achieved substantial growth in 2023, attracting 17.15 million international visitors, witnessing a 19% increase year-on-year. Western Europeans composed the majority of international visitors, representing 19% of the total volume. As of H1 2024, number of international visitors reached 9.31 million, with 1.89 million visitors from Western Europe.  Passenger traffic at the Dubai International Airport has witness an increase of 31.7% YoY, reaching over 87 million visitors in 2023 and surpassing pre-pandemic levels, portraying a remarkable post pandemic recovery. The month of August 2023 has witnessed the most traffic, with the United Kingdom marking the third on the top destination list with over 5.9 million passengers. London remains a leading destination city with 3.7 million visitors. Visitors from Western Europe are projected to further increase as the expected passenger traffic is expected to grow, reaching over 88.8 million visitors by the end of 2024. The UK, being a leading destination, could explain the volume of British real estate investments in Dubai, with British nationals holding an impressive AED 2.5 billion in investments, reflecting their investment appeal towards Dubai. Paris and London were ranked among the top 5 cities by total international visitors, ranked second and third respectively. According to TripAdvisor, Burj Khalifa, Dubai Fountain, Dubai Mall, Dubai Miracle Garden and Global Village were among the top touristic destinations. With the increased number of visitors to Dubai, the demand for hotel accommodation also achieved high growth. For the year 2023, hotel occupancy reached 77%, scoring an average daily rate (ADR) of AED 692 and revenue per room available (RevPAR) of AED 536. The month of February of 2024 witnessed the highest occupancy rate of 90.8%, recording a 3.4% increase from the same period last year. As demand for hotels grow, hotel supply is also growing, with 14 new hotels set to open in the UAE in 2024, 8 being in Dubai alone. Notable hotels set to open this year include Fairmont Dubai Skyline, Jumeirah Marsa Al Arab, Five Luxe and Ciel Tower. Some of the popular hotels amongst European visitors in Dubai are: 1. One & Only One Za’abeel Located at the Trade Centre, this five star hotel offers opulent accommodation, fine dining, transformative wellbeing and crated fashion all under one roof. 2. Address Grand Creek Harbour Located in Dubai Creek, this five star hotel offers splendid views of the sunset from The Viewing Point, refined dinning and luxurious spa experience at the heart of the Creek. 3. Marriott Resort, Palm Jumeirah Located at the iconic Palm West Beach, this five star beachfront hotel caters to both leisure for visitors and tourists and business for dynamic business travelers. 4. Riu Hotels & Resorts Located at the promising Dubai Islands, this four star beachfront hotel caters to sentimental, leisure activities, such as kayaking, while offering a peaceful getaway to all.

The post Growth of European Visitors to Dubai appeared first on Only Luxury.
item.content:encoded:
Dubai’s tourism sector has achieved substantial growth in 2023, attracting 17.15 million international visitors, witnessing a 19% increase year-on-year. Western Europeans composed the majority of international visitors, representing 19% of the total volume. As of H1 2024, number of international visitors reached 9.31 million, with 1.89 million visitors from Western Europe. 

Passenger traffic at the Dubai International Airport has witness an increase of 31.7% YoY, reaching over 87 million visitors in 2023 and surpassing pre-pandemic levels, portraying a remarkable post pandemic recovery. The month of August 2023 has witnessed the most traffic, with the United Kingdom marking the third on the top destination list with over 5.9 million passengers.

London remains a leading destination city with 3.7 million visitors. Visitors from Western Europe are projected to further increase as the expected passenger traffic is expected to grow, reaching over 88.8 million visitors by the end of 2024.

The UK, being a leading destination, could explain the volume of British real estate investments in Dubai, with British nationals holding an impressive AED 2.5 billion in investments, reflecting their investment appeal towards Dubai.

Best Places to Retire in Dubai

Read More

Paris and London were ranked among the top 5 cities by total international visitors, ranked second and third respectively. According to TripAdvisor, Burj Khalifa, Dubai Fountain, Dubai Mall, Dubai Miracle Garden and Global Village were among the top touristic destinations.

With the increased number of visitors to Dubai, the demand for hotel accommodation also achieved high growth. For the year 2023, hotel occupancy reached 77%, scoring an average daily rate (ADR) of AED 692 and revenue per room available (RevPAR) of AED 536. The month of February of 2024 witnessed the highest occupancy rate of 90.8%, recording a 3.4% increase from the same period last year.

As demand for hotels grow, hotel supply is also growing, with 14 new hotels set to open in the UAE in 2024, 8 being in Dubai alone. Notable hotels set to open this year include Fairmont Dubai Skyline, Jumeirah Marsa Al Arab, Five Luxe and Ciel Tower.

Some of the popular hotels amongst European visitors in Dubai are:

1. One & Only One Za’abeel

Located at the Trade Centre, this five star hotel offers opulent accommodation, fine dining, transformative wellbeing and crated fashion all under one roof.

2. Address Grand Creek Harbour

Located in Dubai Creek, this five star hotel offers splendid views of the sunset from The Viewing Point, refined dinning and luxurious spa experience at the heart of the Creek.

Why European Millionaires Are Gravitating to Dubai

Read More

3. Marriott Resort, Palm Jumeirah

Located at the iconic Palm West Beach, this five star beachfront hotel caters to both leisure for visitors and tourists and business for dynamic business travelers.

4. Riu Hotels & Resorts

Located at the promising Dubai Islands, this four star beachfront hotel caters to sentimental, leisure activities, such as kayaking, while offering a peaceful getaway to all.
